summary: This is a letter from U.S. District Judge Richard M. Berman to Warden Lamine N'Diaye of the Metropolitan Correctional Center, written two days after Jeffrey Epstein's death. Judge Berman acknowledges the tragedy and raises an open question about whether ongoing investigations will include the July 23, 2019 incident at the MCC involving Epstein, noting it has never been definitively explained what the BOP concluded about that incident. The letter is copied to several legal and judicial officials.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein died while in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, an event described as a tragedy by Judge Berman.
There was a prior incident involving Jeffrey Epstein at the MCC on or about July 23, 2019, which had never been definitively explained by the Bureau of Prisons (BOP).
Judge Berman explicitly questions whether the investigations into Epstein's death will include this July 23 incident.
The letter is copied to a wide range of high-level legal and law enforcement officials, indicating the case's significance and the desire for broad oversight.
The correspondence occurs just two days after Epstein's death, showing immediate judicial concern and inquiry into the circumstances.
